snippet: The United States trade deficit widened 3.4 percent in October, the Commerce Department said, as exports of American goods fell to the lowest level in more than four years.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports United States trade deficit expanded 3.4 percent in October to $43.9 billion, compared with revised $42.5 billion deficit in September.
lead_paragraph: The United States trade deficit widened 3.4 percent in October, the Commerce Department said, as exports of American goods fell to the lowest level in more than four years.

headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Rose in October to $43.9. Billion
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Deficit Rose In October To $43.9. Billion
